Html:
Hi all,

I am not expererienced with windows audio programming, but maybe some of you are able to give me some ideas. Basically what I want is high quality audio
from a HTPC running Mediaportal.  I intend to build a high quality audio DAC which is connected via ethernet and runs some dedicated protocol over UDP.

The main challenge for me is to find a way to obtain a `bit perfect` audiostream from the player. 
In this case I need some windows playback device which can be selected by audio players. I have no intention to write a windows device driver
and prefer to use c# .net

Any possibilities with naudio to capture a media player audio stream directly, or maybe any other suggestion ?

Thx,
Marcel

NAudio does contain managed wrappers for much of the WASAPI API, but you will need to do your own research to find out how to capture a media player audio stream

Mark
